jparsec.ephem.stars

Class VariableStarElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.stars.VariableStarElement

  • public class VariableStarElement
extends java.lang.Object
    Convenient class for variable stars ephemerides, calculated according to Up-to-date Linear Elements of Close Binaries, J.M. Kreiner, 2004, Acta Astronomica, vol. 54, pp 207-210. See http://www.as.up.krakow.pl/o-c/cont.html for more information on the variable stars.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double declination
      Declination in radians from the catalog.
      java.lang.String eclipsingType
      type of eclipsing binary for eclipsing stars.
      boolean isEclipsing
      True if this star is an eclipsing binary star.
      java.lang.String magRange
      Magnitude range for the variable.
      java.lang.String maximaDates
      Dates of maxima for long-period variable stars, given as Julian days separated by comma.
      java.lang.String minimaDates
      Dates of minima for long-period variable stars, given as Julian days separated by comma.
      double minimaDuration
      Minima duration in days for an eclipsing star.
      double minimaTime
      Heliocentric Julian day of the minima in UTC, for eclipsing stars.
      java.lang.String name
      Name of the star.
      static java.lang.String PATH_VARIABLE_STAR_AAVSO_BULLETIN_2011
      The path to the catalog of variable stars.
      static java.lang.String PATH_VARIABLE_STAR_CATALOG
      The path to the catalog of variable stars.
      double period
      Period in days.
      double rightAscension
      J2000 Right ascension in radians from the catalog.
      java.lang.String spectralType
      Spectral type for eclipsing stars.
      java.lang.String type
      Minima type for eclipsing stars.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VariableStarElement

        public VariableStarElement(java.lang.String nom,
                   double ra,
                   double dec,
                   java.lang.String mag,
                   java.lang.String t,
                   double p,
                   double t0)
        Constructs a variable star object providing the values of the fields.
        Parameters:
        nom - Name.
        ra - Right Ascension in radians.
        dec - Declination in radians.
        mag - Magnitude range.
        t - Type.
        p - Period.
        t0 - Minima time.

        Overrides:

      • getPhase

        public double getPhase()
        Return phase for an eclipsing star, from 0 to 1. 0 or 1 is primary minima (in case of circular orbit), 0.5 is approximatelly the secondary minima.
        Returns:
        Phase.

      • getNextMinima

        public double getNextMinima()
        Return next minima for an eclipsing star.
        Returns:
        Julian day of the next minima in LT.

      • getNextMinima

        public double getNextMinima(TimeElement time,
                   ObserverElement observer)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Return next minima for a long-period variable star.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        observer - Observer object.
        Returns:
        Julian day of the next minima, or 0 if cannot be calculated.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getNextMaxima

        public double getNextMaxima(TimeElement time,
                   ObserverElement observer)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Return next maxima for a long-period variable star.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        observer - Observer object.
        Returns:
        Julian day of the next maxima, or 0 if cannot be calculated.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • onlySecondaryMinima

        public boolean onlySecondaryMinima()
        Return if the observations of this star were done only for secondary minimas, for an eclipsing star.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • calcEphemeris

        public void calcEphemeris(TimeElement time,
                 ObserverElement observer,
                 boolean preferPrecision)
                   throws JPARSECException
        Calculates ephemeris for this variable star if it is an eclipsing star.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        observer - Observer object.
        preferPrecision - True to prefer accuracy over speed (heliocentric Julian day will be corrected to geocentric, resulting in, at most, 8 minutes of difference in the time of the minima).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Testing program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
